element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates a raster layer from a set of points, using the Universal Kriging interpolation method.
Predictors can be used as well in case that first order stacionarity cannot be assumed.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: The field that contains the variable to inteprolate

element.name: DIST
element.text: The search radius in map units. Only points within that area defined by this radius are used

element.name: GRIDS
element.text: select the layers that will act as predictives.

element.name: MINPOINTS
element.text: the minimum number of points that will be used for the interpolation. If there are less points near the cell than the minimum specified, this cell will be assigned the no data value.

element.name: MAXPOINTS
element.text: The maximum number of points that will be used for the interpolation.

element.name: MODEL
element.text: the semivariogram model to use: * Spherical * Exponential * Gaussian

element.name: NUGGET
element.text: The nugget value of the variogram

element.name: SILL
element.text: The sill value of the variogram.

element.name: RANGE
element.text: The range value of the variogram.

element.name: CROSSVALIDATION
element.text: Cross validation table. This is calculated interpolating at the corrdinates of the input points, using all the points except the one at that coordinate. Expected values and values obtained from interpolation are then compared to evaluate the correctness of the model, which is summarized in this table.
